<strong style="display: block;">
An investor places \$1,000 in a risk-free Treasury bill paying 4% per year, and another \$1,000 in a portfolio of U.S. common stocks with an expected return of 12% per year.

<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q14" value="B"> B. 7%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q14" value="C"> C. 8%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q14" value="D"> D. 9%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q14" value="E"> E. 10%</label><br>
</form>
<div id="feedback-module2_mcq_q14" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
